channel.title: NPC No-args constructor?
channel.description:
OK! i need help fAST
My server is not starting due to the fact i have no-args constructor in npc.java
I don't understand!
http://prntscr.com/iyxq8 [code][2012/05/05 17:21:48] [Project DungeonFest]: Project DungeonFest framework [2012/05/05 17:21:48] [Project DungeonFest]: Loaded 15558item prices. item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @gtbarry gtbarry
item.description:
@gtbarry wrote:

can you TV or something?

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

It’s an outside library used for parsing files such as XML, this issue is very common as when Java 7 came out, the old XStream libraries became incompatible, and the newest release fixes this issue. I’d avoid outside libraries at all costs because of this.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @gtbarry gtbarry
item.description:
@gtbarry wrote:

well, it was this or the xstream. and i know NOTHING about xstream

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“gtbarry, post:20, topic:466037”]@clawz fury

Bro! when i added that in,

it came up with an error

Compiling Project DungeonFest by Austin Cadle src\com\rs2hd\model\NPC.java:24: class, interface, or enum expected public NPC() { ^ 1 error Correctly compiled TkoScape Press any key to continue . . . [/quote]
Brackets. This answer will probably result in no NPC’s spawning at all, but go for it.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:3, topic:466037”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=574302.msg4141270#msg4141270 date=1352073895]

[code=java]public NPC() {

}[/code]
[/quote]
no.

Update your XStream libraries.[/quote]
Weird, I had that problem and that fixed it. My apologies.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

They might have changed a few class names. Its up to you to go through the documentation and see for sure though. That’s the risk of using external libraries though.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @gtbarry gtbarry
item.description:
@gtbarry wrote:

xpp3_min-1.1.4c.jar

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I see how its set up, but you must not have added the right libraries then. What is the name of the xpp library that you’ve added?

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @gtbarry gtbarry
item.description:
@gtbarry wrote:

it doesn’t say anything about it in

RUN

@echo off title Project DungeonFest 562 loading 659! cd src cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xms250m -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/* com.rs2hd.Main pause

OR COMPILE

@echo off
title Project DungeonFest Compiler
echo Compiling Project DungeonFest by Austin Cadle
cd src
cd ..
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac" -d bin -cp deps/*; -sourcepath src src/com/rs2hd/Main.java
echo Correctly compiled TkoScape
pause

Read full topic

item.title: NPC No-args constructor?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You need to adjust the run batch’s classpath to include the name of the new XPP library.

Read full topic
